title: EARTH DRILLING, e.g. DEEP DRILLING  (mining, quarrying E21C; making shafts, driving galleries or tunnels E21D); OBTAINING OIL, GAS, WATER, SOLUBLE OR MELTABLE MATERIALS OR A SLURRY OF MINERALS FROM WELLS
definition_statement: This place covers: Earth drilling, e.g. deep drilling;obtaining oil, gas, water, soluble or meltable materials or a slurry of minerals from wells. This subclass also includes drilling at shallow depths but over extended distances, such as drilling for laying a pipeline under surface obstacles.

title: Percussion drilling  (drives used in the borehole E21B4/00)
informative_references: Drives for combined percussion and rotary drillingPortable drilling rigsDerricks, mastsRotary drilling machines in general
definition_statement: This place covers: Machines and methods in which the drilling action is done principally by percussion. The percussive drive is placed outside of the borehole, and the drilling can be for any depth, including drillholes and mining applications:

title: Rotary drilling  (drives used in the borehole E21B4/00; rotary drilling machines in general B23B)
informative_references: Drives for combined percussion and rotary drillingPortable drilling rigsDerricks, mastsRotary drilling machines in general
special_rules: Reference  is non-limiting in the main group . CPC will be corrected once this inconsistency is resolved in IPC.
definition_statement: This place covers: Machines and methods in which the drilling action is done principally by rotation:

title: {movably mounted on the drilling structure or platform  (derricks adapted to be moved on their substructure E21B15/003)}
informative_references: Supports for the drilling machine specially adapted for underwater drilling

title: Drives for drilling, used in the borehole
informative_references: Rotary-piston machines or pumpsMoineau motorsArrangements for handling mechanical energy structurally associated with the machine, e.g. structural association with mechanical driving motor or auxiliary dynamo-electric machine
definition_statement: This place covers: Drives located inside the borehole for powering drilling units:

title: Special methods or apparatus for drilling
informative_references: Rotary or percussion drill bitsDerricks or mastsDrilling rods or pipesSetting of casings when not simultaneous with drilling of the boreholeDetails of, or accessories for, portable power-driven percussive toolsVehicles adapted to transport or to comprise special loadsUnderwater drilling for submerged foundationsErecting posts for fencesMachines for drilling and setting anchoring boltsDetails of hydraulic circuits
definition_statement: This place covers: Drilling methods and apparatus characterised by any aspect that differs from those of conventional drilling, which is understood as drilling a vertical borehole with a roller or drag type bit, using a derrick or mast.

title: {combined with a bucket-type container}
informative_references: Bailers with helical conveying means

title: {Drilling by use of explosives  (underwater drilling using explosives E21B7/1245)}

title: {With a rotary table, i.e. a fixed rotary drive for a relatively advancing tool}
informative_references: Rotary tables

title: Directional drilling {(derricks or masts specially adapted therefor E21B15/04)}
definition_statement: This place covers: Directional drilling in the general sense of producing a borehole in a direction other that vertical. The drilling direction can be essentially horizontal, such as for laying a pipe under an obstruction or in an urban environment.

title: Deflecting the direction of boreholes
informative_references: Directional window cuttingDeflecting the direction of fishing tools

title: Driving or forcing casings or pipes into boreholes, e.g. sinking; Simultaneously drilling and casing boreholes  (surface means for applying to-and-fro rotation movements to the casing E21B3/025; placing piles E02D7/00; sinking shafts while moving the lining downwards E21D1/08 {; making galleries by forcing prefabricated elements through the ground E21D9/005})
informative_references: Pushing means outside of the borehole
definition_statement: This place covers: Methods in which the drilling action takes place simultaneously with the installation of a casing or of the pipe to be installed, with the borehole being horizontal or not.

title: Enlarging drilled holes, e.g. by counterboring  (drill bits for enlarging the borehole E21B10/26)
definition_statement: This place covers: Vertical or horizontal drilling, in which means are provided for enlarging a borehole made previously, which borehole may have been made by the same machine carrying out the enlargement, or by a different machine or in a previous operation:

definition_statement: This place covers: Drill bits for any application in earth drilling, be it deep drilling for oil and gas or rock drilling for mining or for use in an underground space.

The application is typically for drilling, i.e. vertical, horizontal, deep drilling, mining or other earth drilling, but can also be for well treatment or other.

special_rules: The technical field  is an application field, wherein many different tools performing various functions find use. Care should be taken not to classify in  documents describing methods or apparatus marginally related to oil and gas drilling and production for which no suitable class in  can be found. Such documents should instead be classified in the groups corresponding to their specific function.

title: Methods or apparatus for obtaining oil, gas, water, soluble or meltable materials or a slurry of minerals from wells  (applicable only to water E03B; obtaining oil-bearing deposits or soluble or meltable materials by mining techniques E21C41/00; pumps F04)
informative_references: Survey of wellbore pump systemsPumpsMultiphase pumpsJet pumps
special_rules: Enhanced recovery methods (), methods for stimulating production () and methods of fracturing () are sometimes carried out on the basis of specific chemical compositions. In these cases, the use of those compositions is seen as a method carried out by chemists, and therefore classified respectively in ,  and .Reference  is non-limiting in the main group . CPC will be corrected once this inconsistency is resolved in IPC.
definition_statement: This place covers: Methods and equipment for completion of wellbores and control and improvement of production.

title: Perforators; Permeators
definition_statement: This place covers: Perforators and guns used to create apertures in casing or formation in order to establish a fluid communication with the reservoir for the production of oil or gas. Included are details about construction, ignition, communication and placement.

title: Gun or shaped-charge perforators
informative_references: Projectiles with shaped or hollow charge

title: {Dropping perforation guns after gun actuation}
informative_references: Releasing-joints between rod or the like and bit or between rod and rod or the like

title: Methods or apparatus for controlling the flow of the obtained fluid to or in wells  (E21B43/25 takes precedence; valve arrangements E21B34/00)
informative_references: Valve arrangements for boreholes or wells
special_rules: Looping references between  and  have been identified. Until this inconsistency is resolved in IPC, the current classification practice in CPC is as follows: reference  is non-limiting in the subgroup . CPC will be corrected once this inconsistency is resolved in IPC.
definition_statement: This place covers: Production pumps, lifting wellbore fluids, production chokes:

title: Enhanced recovery methods for obtaining hydrocarbons  (fracturing E21B43/26; obtaining slurry E21B43/29; reclamation of contaminated soil in situ B09C  {; chemical compositions therefor C09K8/58})
definition_statement: This place covers: Increasing the fraction of original oil recovered in place in a reservoir, including waterflooding, chemical flooding, gas injection, and thermal methods:

title: using heat, e.g. steam injection  (heating, cooling or insulating wells E21B36/00 {; in combination with organic material C09K8/592})

title: {by means of nuclear energy}
informative_references: Nuclear reactors

title: Methods for stimulating production  (dump bailers E21B27/02; vibration generating arrangements E21B28/00; {by vibrating earth formations E21B43/003;} chemical compositions therefor C09K8/60)
definition_statement: This place covers: Treatment to restore or enhance the permeability of a well, typically hydraulic fracturing treatments and matrix treatments (acidizing):

title: {by means of nuclear energy}
informative_references: Peaceful applications of nuclear explosive devices in general

title: Dissolving minerals other than hydrocarbons, e.g. by an alkaline or acid leaching agent  (E21B43/241 takes precedence)
informative_references: Using steerable or laterally extendable nozzles
definition_statement: This place covers: Production of minerals other than hydrocarbons by dissolving them in situ with a dissolving agent:

title: {using heat}
informative_references: heating, cooling or insulating wells

title: Gasification of minerals, e.g. for producing mixtures of combustible gases  (E21B43/243 takes precedence)
glossary_of_terms: Coal undergroundA method for exploiting poor-quality mineral and thin seams by burning the mineral in place to produce combustible gas which can be burned to generate power or processed into chemicals and fuels
definition_statement: This place covers: Obtention of combustible gas from mineral bodies, usually from coal underground.

title: Arrangements for separating materials produced by the well  (separating apparatus per se, see the relevant subclasses)
definition_statement: This place covers: Separation of materials produced by the well:

title: Automatic control systems specially adapted for drilling operations, i.e. self-operating systems which function to carry out or modify a drilling operation without intervention of a human operator, e.g. computer-controlled drilling systems  (for non-automatic drilling control, see the operation controlled; automatic feeding from rack and connecting of drilling pipes E21B19/20; controlling pressure or flow of drilling fluid E21B21/08); Systems specially adapted for monitoring a plurality of drilling variables or conditions  (means for transmitting measuring-signals from the well to the surface E21B47/12)
informative_references: Control systems in general
definition_statement: This place covers: Methods and devices such as sensors for monitoring drilling operations and for controlling the drilling operation in response to the information obtained:

title: Arrangements for automatic stopping when the tool is lifted from the working face
informative_references: Arrangements for automatic stopping for portable percussive tools

title: Survey of boreholes or wells  (monitoring pressure or flow of drilling fluid E21B21/08)
informative_references: Testing of formations and obtaining samples of fluids or of borehole wallsGeophysical loggingDetails, e.g. power supply systems for well logging instruments
special_rules: Documents are classified in  if they disclose a specific application in a downhole environment.Commonplace measurements such as temperature or pressure should only be classified in  if specific measurement techniques are disclosed, or if the temperature or pressure data is relevant for the execution of another operation.
glossary_of_terms: BoreholeAn unlined shaft drilled into the ground, typically for the purposes of extracting water, crude oil or natural gas. This is often referred to as the wellbore.
definition_statement: This place covers: Sensors or devices for obtaining data relative to the wellbore itself. Means for sending information from the well to the surface or from the surface into the well.

title: by visual inspection
informative_references: Photographing internal surfaces, e.g. of pipesClosed circuit television systems

title: Determining well or borehole volumes  (determining depth E21B47/04; diameter E21B47/08)
informative_references: Measuring volumes in general

title: Monitoring or checking of cementation quality or level
informative_references: Measuring temperature at borehole or well
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes or apparatus for tracking or examining the extent or integrity of the plugging or consolidating material.

title: Devices for supporting measuring instruments on drill bits, pipes, rods or wirelines; Protecting measuring instruments in boreholes against heat, shock, pressure or the like
informative_references: Flexible or expansible centering means per seSetting or locking tools in boreholes or wells
definition_statement: This place covers: Devices for mounting a data collection instrument upon a boring tool, boring tool string or cable-carried tool; Devices for shielding down-hole data collection instruments from damage.

title: Protecting measuring instruments
informative_references: Cooling or insulating arrangements for boreholes or wells
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes or apparatus for shielding the data collection device against thermal effect, vibration, pressure, debris or the like.

title: {Cooling arrangements}
informative_references: Cooling or insulating arrangements for boreholes or wells

title: Determining slope or direction
informative_references: Clinometers or direction meters in general
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes or apparatus for measuring the inclination or orientation of boreholes or wells.

title: of penetrated ground layers
informative_references: Apparatus for obtaining oriented coresFormation testing
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes or apparatus for measuring the inclination (i.e. dip) or orientation (i.e. strike) of a drilled stratum, e.g. by using a specially adapted compass (e.g. a Brunton compass).

title: Measuring depth or liquid level
informative_references: Measuring depth in generalMeasuring liquid level in general and telerecorders for level of liquids

title: Measuring temperature or pressure
informative_references: Measuring temperature in general; Telerecorders for temperatureMeasuring pressure in general; Telerecorders for pressure

title: Measuring diameters or related dimensions at the borehole
informative_references: Measuring diameter in general

title: Locating or determining the position of objects in boreholes or wells {, e.g. the position of an extending arm}; Identifying the free or blocked portions of pipes
informative_references: Measuring depth at borehole or wellMeasuring borehole or well diameter

title: by detecting magnetic anomalies
informative_references: Investigating materials by investigating magnetic variables
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes or apparatus for determining the whereabouts or position of objects in a borehole or well using magnetic attraction/repulsion force irregularities.

title: Locating fluid leaks, intrusions or movements {(using impression packers E21B47/098)}
informative_references: Flow measurement in generalExamining density and leaking in general
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes or apparatus for determining if the pipes are sufficiently fluid-tight to prevent leakage or ingress of liquid or gas. Processes or apparatus for detecting unwanted fluids flowing from the formation into the borehole. Processes or apparatus for detecting the presence and properties of production fluids in the borehole. Processes or apparatus for determining well debit or flow rate.

title: Detecting leaks, e.g. from tubing, by pressure testing
informative_references: Investigating fluid-tightness of structures by using fluid or vacuum

title: Means for transmitting measuring-signals or control signals from the well to the surface, or from the surface to the well, e.g. for logging while drilling
informative_references: Remote signaling in general
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes or apparatus in which an information or control signal is sent to or from equipment located in the borehole over an information transmission link, for the purpose of measuring while boring.

title: using earth as an electrical conductor  (E21B47/13 takes precedence)
informative_references: Magnetic or electric prospectingElectronic transmission systems in which the earth is the medium
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes or apparatus in which the transmission link is through the ground.

title: by electromagnetic energy, e.g. radio frequency
informative_references: Magnetic or electric prospectingElectronic transmission in general

title: using light waves, e.g. infrared or ultraviolet waves
informative_references: Light guides, e.g. optical fibresOptical transmission in general

informative_references: Recording in connection with measuring in generalRecording seismic dataRecording data of measuring magnetic field characteristic of the earthInformation storage in general
